title: How to Square Your Duct Tape Sheet

parts.name: Setting Up the Duct Tape Sheet

steps.headline: Place your duct tape sheet on a flat surface.
steps.description: Lay the sheet of paper on top of it. Ensure that one side of the duct tape sheet is as straight as it can be. Use this side as a guide and lay the paper on top of it. You're going to cut the edge that you want to be square by cutting along the edge of the paper.

steps.headline: Attach the paper firmly to the duct tape sheet.
steps.description: Clamps can be used to hold duct tape to the paper.

steps.headline: Cut along your targeted edge with the two pieces fastened firmly together.
Remove the clips after you are done with the first side.
steps.description: Use the edge that you just cut as the guide and move the clips there.

steps.headline: Repeat until you are done.
steps.description: This image shows a finished project with straighter edges than would have been accomplished freehand.

text: Setting Up the Duct Tape Sheet Place your duct tape sheet on a flat surface. Lay the sheet of paper on top of it. Ensure that one side of the duct tape sheet is as straight as it can be. Use this side as a guide and lay the paper on top of it. You're going to cut the edge that you want to be square by cutting along the edge of the paper. Attach the paper firmly to the duct tape sheet. Clamps can be used to hold duct tape to the paper. Cutting the Duct Tape Sheet Cut along your targeted edge with the two pieces fastened firmly together.  Remove the clips after you are done with the first side. Use the edge that you just cut as the guide and move the clips there. Cut the next edge.  Repeat until you are done. This image shows a finished project with straighter edges than would have been accomplished freehand.
